title: SQL 2014 Developer: Partitions, Queries and XML
headline: Learn about SQL Server 2014 Developer along with data types and partitioning methods in this free online course.
description: This free online course on Microsoft SQL Server 2014 Developer covers the fundamental topics necessary to build, manage and maintain databases. The course takes learners through the processes needed to efficiently perform various management tasks on databases. You will also be introduced to the new and advanced features available. Start this course to update your SQL Server knowledge today.

courseDescription:
Are you looking for a free online course with rich content on the essential points important to manage, build and maintain databases in SQL Server 2014? If your answer is yes, then you are in the right place. The course takes learners through the processes required to productively play out the administration assignments on their databases. The course begins by explaining the concept of partitioning. It introduces the learners to how partitioning enhances the performance, manageability and availability of a wide variety of applications. You will discuss the key terms and the syntax for defining a partition. You will also get to know about the partitioning function as a way to divide a large table into smaller, more manageable parts without having to create separate tables for each part. The course also outlines the various versions of SQL Server including SQL server 2014, 2016, 2017 and 2019.

The course goes on to explain the SQL data types allowed for null values. It discusses the native common language runtime (CLR) data types found in the .NET Framework and the simple ways of running native CLR data types that do not allow for the direct assignment of a null value. You will also learn about the outcomes of queries and logical operations when a null value is involved. Grouped data are data formed by aggregating individual observations of a variable into groups. The course describes the concept of ranking grouped data and how it is done with SQL. You will learn about correlated subqueries, a subquery that uses the values of the outer query, and the reasons why a correlated subquery cannot be executed independently as a simple subquery. Common table expressions (CTEs), the two types of CTEs and their uses will also be covered.

Next, the course explores the concepts of working with multinational data. It illustrates how to query hierarchical data using the hierarchyid data type. You will be taken through the issues with data types in SQL Server attempts to convert operands to the same data type. You will learn about the principles of writing more efficient queries and specify which operations within queries can be improved. The course highlights the areas that can cause performance issues, the different ways to resolve data when working on multiple tables and the EXISTS clause. It also touches on important topical areas around SQL Server over the years including the XML data type in view of the functionality and limitations in the previous SQL Server versions. Are you an experienced database professional with experience in SQL and looking to learn more advanced features on SQL 2014? If so, then this course is perfect for you. 

Start Course Now

Alison offers 3 types of Diplomas for completed Diploma courses:
  • Digital certificate: a downloadable certificate in PDF format immediately available to you when you complete your purchase.
  • certificate: a physical version of your officially branded and security-marked certificate, posted to you with FREE shipping.
  • Framed certificate: a physical version of your officially branded and security marked certificate in a stylish frame, posted to you with FREE shipping.

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, you will be introduced to the various concepts of partitioning. This module analyzes the challenges faced by database designers and compares techniques for the various SQL server. Also, it outlines the syntax for defining the partition function and explores catalogue view as well as some of the catalogue views available for retrieving partition information.

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, you will be introduced to the concepts of complex querying and the functions used for ranking grouped data. This module also illustrates how to write correlated subqueries as well as analyzes the common table expression (CTE) and the terms used.

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, you will be introduced to the various concepts of coding techniques and the structure used for working with multiple data. This module also analysis the various ways to improve Queries, as well as simple processes used when working with complex queries.

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, you will be introduced to the concepts of working with the XML data type along with the XML schema collections. This module also illustrates the various ways data querying on XML are carried out as well as the best practices.
